definition: to put to the torch (idiom)/to commit to the flames/to burn sth down deliberately
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Twenty laundries were burned that night.
sentences.chinese: 当天晚上，华人开设的洗衣店就有二十家被付之一炬。

sentences.english: The cathedral was destroyed by the Great Fire of 1136 AD.
sentences.chinese: 大教堂在公元1136年的大火中被付之一炬。

sentences.english: In a fury, he consigned all his manuscripts to the flames.
sentences.chinese: 盛怒之下，他将所有的手稿都付之一炬。

sentences.english: My entire worldly wealth was swallowed up, and I resigned myself 12)thenceforward to despair.
sentences.chinese: 我所有的财产都付之一炬，我从此万念俱灰。

sentences.english: My nephew committed all the letters from his girl friend to the flames.
sentences.chinese: 我侄儿把他女朋友给他的所有的信件都付之一炬。

sentences.english: I think she would like to burn our houses down.
sentences.chinese: 我认为她很想把我们的房子付之一炬。

sentences.english: Color's delivering a purple disease to harm pork is confined to the flames in the flaming wildfire.
sentences.chinese: 颜色发紫的病害猪肉也在熊熊大火中被付之一炬。

sentences.english: Their home was destroyed — along with three puppies that were inside.
sentences.chinese: 最终这家人的屋子付之一炬，连带屋中的三只小狗。

sentences.english: For it can contain nothing but sophistry and illusion.
sentences.chinese: 那就将它付之一炬，因为它含有的不过是诡辩和幻想。

sentences.english: I commit this evil book to the flames.
sentences.chinese: 我把这本坏书付之一炬。

sentences.english: My entire worldly wealth was swallowed up, and I resigned myself thenceforward to despair.
sentences.chinese: 我所有的财产都付之一炬，我从此万念俱灰。

sentences.english: All of my hard-work and savings was seemingly for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我所有的辛勤工作与积蓄都似乎付之一炬了。

definition: to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀
to burn down/to destroy with fire
to level/to raze to the ground
to blow up/to destroy with explosives
to set on fire/to commit arson
to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
